title: Second Quantization and Evolution Operators in Infinite Dimension.pdf
abstract: In an inﬁnite dimensional separable Hilbert space X, we study compactness properties and the hypercontractivity of the Ornstein-Uhlenbeck evolution operators Ps,t in the spaces Lp(X, γt), {γt}t∈R being a suitable evolution system of measures for Ps,t. Moreover we study the asymptotic behavior of Ps,t. All these results are produced thank to a representation of Ps,t through the second quantization operator. Among the examples we consider the transition evolution operator associated to a non-autonomous stochastic parabolic PDE. 1 Introduction Let (X, ⟨·, ·⟩X, ∥· ∥X) be a separable Hilbert space. Let {U(t, s)}s≤t be an evolution operator in X and let {B(t)}t∈R be a strongly continuous family of linear bounded operators on X. In this paper we consider the evolution operator {Ps,t}s≤t deﬁned on the space of bounded and Borel measurable functions ϕ by Pt,t = I, ∀t ∈R, Ps,tϕ(x) = Z X ϕ(y) NU(t,s)x,Q(t,s)(dy), s < t, x ∈X, where NU(t,s)x,Q(t,s) is the Gaussian measure in X with mean U(t, s)x and covariance operator Q(t, s) = Z t s U(t, r)Q(r)U(t, r)⋆dr, Q(r) := B(r)B(r)⋆. (1.1) As shown in [22, 47], Ps,t extends to Lp-type spaces of measures belonging to a evolution systems of measures for Ps,t, namely families of Borel probability measures {γt}t∈R in X such that Z X Ps,tϕ(x)γs(dx) = Z X ϕ(x)γt(dx). Moreover in [22, 47] the authors gave conditions that guarantee existence and uniqueness of an evo- lution system of measures {γt}t∈R where γt is the Gaussian measure with mean zero and covariance operator Q(t, −∞) = Z t −∞ U(t, r)Q(r)U(t, r)⋆dr, and it satisﬁes lim s→−∞Ps,tϕ(x) = Z X ϕ(y) γt(dy), t ∈R, x ∈X, 1
